data.title: Stig Arve Sæther
data.text:
Stig Arve Sæther is a Professor in sport science. His main research interests include; talent development, youth sport and sport psychology. Sæther has published close to forty articles in international journals and three books. His largest research project is a longitudinal 10 year follow-up on a age-cohorte of youth national football players from 2005-2015, and ended with the book De norske fotballtalentene (2017) based on this project. Sæther is head of the research group: Skill and Performance Development in Sport and School, Deputy head of education at the Department of Sociology and Political science and head of staff in sport science.

Sæther is associate editor in the journals: Scandinavian Journal of Sport and Exercise Psychology and Cogent Social Sciences (sport section)

Sæther has researched skill and performance development within a number of topics and sports, but with the main emphasis on football. His research has particularly concentrated on the transition between junior and into elite sport at senior level, both from an athlete and coach perspective. Some of the topics he has researched are linked to structural frameworks for development such as the concept of talent, talent development environment and relative age difference, but also exercise characteristics such as amount of training, motivation, perfectionism, as well as factors that affect the athlete's development in the form of stress, dual career and the selection process.

Research projects:

* Fotball og talent

* Ecology of Athlete Development - University of SouthernDenmark

* Coaching og prestasjonsutvikling i talentutviklingsmiljø

* The Female Athlete - MITT University

* Female athletes – a different talent developmentprocess?

Prevoius projects:

* Football academies

* Road to the top

* Modernising sport psychology in English football
